title: Google\Cloud\Logging\V2\LogExclusion
name: LogExclusion
description:
Specifies a set of log entries that are filtered out by a sink. If your Google Cloud resource receives a large volume of log entries, you can use exclusions to reduce your chargeable logs. Note that exclusions on organization-level and folder-level sinks don't apply to child resources.

Note also that you cannot modify the _Required sink or exclude logs from it.

Generated from protobuf message google.logging.v2.LogExclusion

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. A client-assigned identifier, such as "load-balancer-exclusion". Identifiers are limited to 100 characters and can include only letters, digits, underscores, hyphens, and periods. First character has to be alphanumeric.

params.name: data.filter
params.description: Required. An advanced logs filter that matches the log entries to be excluded. By using the sample function, you can exclude less than 100% of the matching log entries. For example, the following query matches 99% of low-severity log entries from Google Cloud Storage buckets: resource.type=gcs_bucket severity<ERROR sample(insertId, 0.99)

params.name: data.disabled
params.description: Optional. If set to True, then this exclusion is disabled and it does not exclude any log entries. You can [update an exclusion][google.logging.v2.ConfigServiceV2.UpdateExclusion] to change the value of this field.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The creation timestamp of the exclusion. This field may not be present for older exclusions.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The last update timestamp of the exclusion. This field may not be present for older exclusions.
